result.execSummary:
The defendant Kacey Lee Powless was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kacey Lee Powless is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kacey Lee Powless was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kacey Lee Powless

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kacey Lee Powless in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CT1 & 15CM166 tracking together:
Atty Frank states that the matters are resolved.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 in 15CM166 and Ct. 1 in 16CT1.  Ct. 2 in 15CM166 to be dismissed.  Atty Frank agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 15CM166 and Ct. 1 in 16CT1.  Ct. 2 in 15CM166 to be dismissed.

Atty Frank makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  15CM166, Ct. 1:  Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200 Surcharge
Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

16CT1:  Court orders 5 days in the Marquette County Jail
Credit = 4 days
Time Served
Pay fine and costs = $1,179.00
DNA Sample + $200 Surcharge
12 month DL Revocation and Ignition Interlock
AODA and any follow-up treatment
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on December 1, 2016

Atty Frank asks that the IID requirement start when she gets her license back.
BY THE COURT:  Court orders IID to start when the defendant gets her license reinstated.

Atty Frank withdraws his request for the IID.
BY THE COURT:  IID request withdrawn

ADDRESS INFO for Kacey Lee Powless
Current: 136 Pearl St Apt 10, Redgranite, WI 54970 United States  (Effective: 10-05-2016)
Prior: 320 N Clinton St, Princeton, WI 54968
Return date on November 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
